cluster.name: Door Lock
cluster.description: An interface to a generic way to secure a door

feature.name: PINCredential
feature.summary: Lock supports PIN credentials (via keypad, or over-the-air)

feature.name: FingerCredentials
feature.summary: Lock supports finger related credentials (fingerprint, finger vein)

feature.name: WeekDayAccessSchedules
feature.summary: Lock supports week day user access schedules

feature.name: DoorPositionSensor
feature.summary: Lock supports a door position sensor that indicates door's state

feature.name: FaceCredentials
feature.summary: Lock supports face related credentials (face, iris, retina)

feature.name: CredentialOverTheAirAccess
feature.summary: PIN codes over-the-air supported for lock/unlock operations

feature.name: User
feature.summary: Lock supports the user commands and database

feature.name: YearDayAccessSchedules
feature.summary: Lock supports year day user access schedules

feature.name: AliroProvisioning
feature.summary: Lock supports Aliro credential provisioning as defined in [Aliro]

feature.name: AliroBLEUWB
feature.summary: Lock supports the Bluetooth LE + UWB Access Control Flow as defined in [Aliro]

command.name: LockDoor
command.description: This command causes the lock device to lock the door.

command.name: UnlockDoor
command.description: This command causes the lock device to unlock the door.

command.name: UnlockWithTimeout
command.description: This command causes the lock device to unlock the door with a timeout parameter.

command.name: SetPINCode
command.description: Set a PIN Code into the lock.

command.name: GetPINCode
command.description: Retrieve a PIN Code.

command.name: GetPINCodeResponse
command.description: Returns the PIN for the specified user ID.

command.name: ClearPINCode
command.description: Clear a PIN code or all PIN codes.

command.name: ClearAllPINCodes
command.description: Clear out all PINs on the lock.

command.name: SetUserStatus
command.description: Set the status of a user ID.

command.name: GetUserStatus
command.description: Get the status of a user.

command.name: GetUserStatusResponse
command.description: Returns the user status for the specified user ID.

command.name: SetWeekDaySchedule
command.description: Set a weekly repeating schedule for a specified user.

command.name: GetWeekDaySchedule
command.description: Retrieve the specific weekly schedule for the specific user.

command.name: GetWeekDayScheduleResponse
command.description: Returns the weekly repeating schedule data for the specified schedule index.

command.name: ClearWeekDaySchedule
command.description: Clear the specific weekly schedule or all weekly schedules for the specific user.

command.name: SetYearDaySchedule
command.description: Set a time-specific schedule ID for a specified user.

command.name: GetYearDaySchedule
command.description: Retrieve the specific year day schedule for the specific schedule and user indexes.

command.name: GetYearDayScheduleResponse
command.description: Returns the year day schedule data for the specified schedule and user indexes.

command.name: ClearYearDaySchedule
command.description: Clears the specific year day schedule or all year day schedules for the specific user.

command.name: SetHolidaySchedule
command.description: Set the holiday Schedule by specifying local start time and local end time with respect to any Lock Operating Mode.

command.name: GetHolidaySchedule
command.description: Get the holiday schedule for the specified index.

command.name: GetHolidayScheduleResponse
command.description: Returns the Holiday Schedule Entry for the specified Holiday ID.

command.name: ClearHolidaySchedule
command.description: Clears the holiday schedule or all holiday schedules.

command.name: SetUserType
command.description: Set the user type for a specified user.

command.name: GetUserType
command.description: Retrieve the user type for a specific user.

command.name: GetUserTypeResponse
command.description: Returns the user type for the specified user ID.

command.name: SetRFIDCode
command.description: Set an ID for RFID access into the lock.

command.name: GetRFIDCode
command.description: Retrieve an RFID code.

command.name: GetRFIDCodeResponse
command.description: Returns the RFID code for the specified user ID.

command.name: ClearRFIDCode
command.description: Clear an RFID code or all RFID codes.

command.name: ClearAllRFIDCodes
command.description: Clear out all RFIDs on the lock.

command.name: SetUser
command.description: Set user into the lock.

command.name: GetUser
command.description: Retrieve user.

command.name: GetUserResponse
command.description: Returns the user for the specified UserIndex.

command.name: ClearUser
command.description: Clears a user or all Users.

command.name: SetCredential
command.description: Set a credential (e.g.

command.name: SetCredentialResponse
command.description: Returns the status for setting the specified credential.

command.name: GetCredentialStatus
command.description: Retrieve the status of a particular credential (e.g.

command.name: GetCredentialStatusResponse
command.description: Returns the status for the specified credential.

command.name: ClearCredential
command.description: Clear one, one type, or all credentials except ProgrammingPIN credential.

command.name: UnboltDoor
command.description: This command causes the lock device to unlock the door without pulling the latch.

command.name: SetAliroReaderConfig
command.description: This command allows communicating an Aliro Reader configuration, as defined in [Aliro], to the lock.

command.name: ClearAliroReaderConfig
command.description: This command allows clearing an existing Aliro Reader configuration for the lock.

event.name: DoorLockAlarm
event.description: The door lock server provides several alarms which can be sent when there is a critical state on the door lock.

event.name: DoorStateChange
event.description: The door lock server sends out a DoorStateChange event when the door lock door state changes.

event.name: LockOperation
event.description: The door lock server sends out a LockOperation event when the event is triggered by the various lock operation sources.

event.name: LockOperationError
event.description: The door lock server sends out a LockOperationError event when a lock operation fails for various reasons.

event.name: LockUserChange
event.description: The door lock server sends out a LockUserChange event when a lock user, schedule, or credential change has occurred.
